title: Jared Leto donates to families in need for the #Goodthingschallenge and calls on Cara Delevigne
text:
Good deeds are contagious.

And Jared Leto was hoping to spread some around on Tuesday when she revealed his $10,000 donations to two families.

The Dallas Buyers Club star tweeted out his completed #GoodThingsChallenge and tagged some of his famous friends to get in on the action.

Good deed Jared: Jared Leto tweeted out fundraisers he donated $10k to for the #GoodThingsChallenge, on Tuesday

Jared said it was his friend, music producer, Zedd who nominated him for the #GoodThingsChallenge.

'For my good thing I donated to these people,' he said and linked to two separate GoFundMe pages.

He was marked as having donated $5,000 to each fundraiser, while asking his friends to do something good as well.

Jared tagged model and actress Cara Delevigne, Imagine Dragon's front-man Dan Reynolds and The Chainsmoker's Drew Taggart.

Man of his word: Jared said it was his friend, music producer, Zedd who nominated him for the #GoodThingsChallenge. He was marked as having donated $5,000 to each fundraiser, while asking his friends to do something good as well

Their turn: Jared tagged model and actress Cara Delevigne, Imagine Dragon's front-man Dan Reynolds and The Chainsmoker's Drew Taggart

He went on to explain the conditions of those he donated to, from a car accident to surviving burns.

'Zaid survived [severe] burns as a two year old when his bed accidentally caught fire, ' the 30 Seconds to Mars crooner wrote of his first donation. 'The funds will be used for functional surgeries and potential reconstructive procedures.'

Zaid's fundraiser has raised over $290,000 of a $100,000 goal.

His second donation went to Griffin, three-months, and Watson, 18-months. The boys were in a stroller when a car hit them.

'Watson suffered a broken neck, broken pelvis and lacerated liver,' he wrote. 'Griffin suffered a full break skull fracture, broken clavicle and abrasions,'

The young boy's campaign has raised over $89,000 of $100,000 goal.

Zedd created the challenge, and it was described by his streamer friend, Ninja, as doing 'a favor, a donation, pay for a coffee, open a door for someone, anything good at all.'

Jared ended his tweets by saying 'I encourage everyone to do the #goodthingschallenge. Remember the smallest gesture can make a big impact/]...even if it's just a hello.'
